subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Igor Larionov, one of the best players in the world for the dominant teams of the former Soviet Union, was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame as part of a class that also included the longtime Edmonton Oilers wing Glenn Anderson, the linesman Ray Scapinello and the junior hockey builder Ed Chynoweth. Larionov was one of the first Soviet players to join an N.H.L. team, signing with Vancouver in 1989.
